sqlMap.select: SELECT a.* FROM sys_auth_func a LEFT JOIN sys_role_func b ON a.Id = b.Func_Id LEFT JOIN sys_role c ON b.Role_Id = c.Id LEFT JOIN sys_role_user d ON c.Id = d.Role_Id WHERE d.User_Id = :userId ORDER BY a.Rank DESC

SELECT a.id,a.userName,a.name,a.Email,a.Phone,a.status, e.Role_Id roleId,f.`Name` AS roleName FROM sys_user a LEFT JOIN sys_role_user e ON a.Id = e.User_Id LEFT JOIN sys_role f ON e.Role_Id = f.Id where 1=1 #notEmpty($name) AND a.name like '%$name%' #end #notEmpty($userName) AND a.userName =:userName #end #notEmpty($roleId) AND e.Role_Id =:roleId #end GROUP BY a.Id limit :start,:end

SELECT count(1) records from (SELECT count(1) records FROM sys_user a LEFT JOIN sys_role_user e ON a.Id = e.User_Id LEFT JOIN sys_role f ON e.Role_Id = f.Id where 1=1 #notEmpty($name) AND a.name like '%$name%' #end #notEmpty($userName) AND a.userName =:userName #end #notEmpty($roleId) AND e.Role_Id =:roleId #end GROUP BY a.Id ) a
sqlMap.update: update sys_user a,sys_role_user r set r.Role_Id=:roleId,a.UserName=:userName, a.Name=:name,a.Email=:email,a.Phone= :phone,a.Status=:status WHERE r.User_Id=a.Id AND a.Id=:id
update sys_user set Password = :password where id = :id
